26121:

Upgrades your Watch Towers and lets you build Sentry Towers, which are stronger.

28063:
Advance to Tool Age (‹cost›; two Stone Age buildings)
Improves your civilization. Gives you access to different buildings, more powerful military units, and stronger technologies. Before you can advance, you must have any two Stone Age buildings: Storage Pit, Granary, Dock, or Barracks.
28064:
Advance to Bronze Age (‹cost›; two Tool Age buildings)
Improves your civilization. Gives you access to different buildings, more powerful military units, and stronger technologies. Before you can advance, you must have any two Tool Age buildings: Market, Archery Range, or Stable.
28065:
Advance to Iron Age (‹cost›; two Bronze Age buildings)
Improves your civilization. Gives you access to different buildings, more powerful military units, and stronger technologies. Before you can advance, you must have any two Bronze Age buildings: Temple, Government Center, Siege Workshop, or Academy.

120150:
Chariot and Priest civilization

• Farms cost -20%
• Gold Miners work 20% faster and carry +2 gold
• Chariot units +33% hit points
• Priests +2/+3 range in Bronze/Iron Age

Team Bonus:
Priests +1P Armor
120151:
Infantry and Naval civilization

• Town Centers work 10% faster starting from Tool Age
• Academy units move 30% faster and cost -20%
• Ships move 20% faster
• Polytheism and Astrology free (requires Temple)

Team Bonus:
Markets cost -50%
120152:
Defensive civilization

• Stone Miners work 20% faster and carry +2 stone
• Market technologies cost -30%
• Walls and towers +60% hit points
• Priests rejuvenate 30% faster
• Chariots +1P Armor

Team Bonus:
Builders work 10% faster
120153:
Archer and Siege civilization

• Villagers move 10% faster
• Archers fire 11/22/33% faster in Tool/Bronze/Iron Age
• Siege unit upgrades cost -50%

Team Bonus:
Siege Workshops work 20% faster
120154:
Archer and Naval civilization

• Ships cost -15/-20/-25/-30% in Stone/Tool/Bronze/Iron Age
• Improved Bowman-line +1/+2 range in Bronze/Iron Age
• Farmers work 10% faster

Team Bonus:
Docks cost -20%
120155:
Archer and Siege civilization

• All archers +1 attack
• Stone Thrower, Catapult, and Heavy Catapult +50% hit points
• War ships (except Fire Galley) +1/+2/+3 range in Tool/Bronze/Iron Age
• Wheel -50% cost and research time

Team Bonus:
Towers provide +4 population room
120156:
Elephant and Naval civilization

• Woodcutters work 15% faster and carry +2 wood
• Elephant units cost -25%
• Catapult Trireme and Juggernaut fire 33% faster
• Docks +150 HP, +4 line of sight

Team Bonus:
Archers +2 line of sight
120157:
Economic and Siege civilization

• Villagers +15 hit points
• Stone Thrower, Catapult, Heavy Catapult fire 45% faster
• Farms +125 Food
• Camels +1P Armor

Team Bonus:
Town Centers cost -25%
120158:
Elephant and Naval civilization

• Hunters work 30% faster and carry +3 food
• Elephant units move 25% faster
• Scout Ship line fires 18/25/33% faster in Tool/Bronze/Iron Age
• Walls cost -20%

Team Bonus:
Stables work 20% faster
120159:
Economic and Cavalry civilization

• Villagers cost 40 Food
• Start the game with -40 Food
• Walls +60% hit points
• Cavalry-line attacks 10% faster

Team Bonus:
Town centers provide +4 population room
120160:
Cavalry and Naval civilization

• Fishing boats work 20% faster
• All cavalry units and Horse Archers cost -15%
• Ships +10/+15/+20/+25% HP in Stone/Tool/Bronze/Iron Age
• Stable and Archery Range upgrades cost -30%

Team Bonus:
Stables and Archery Ranges cost -33% wood
120161:
Infantry and Tower civilization

• Axeman, Short/Broad/Long Swordsmen and Legion +5/+15/+20/+60/+80 hit points
• Storage Pit technologies cost -40%
• Towers +2 range
• Priests cost -30%

Team Bonus:
Buildings +2 line of sight
120162:
Infantry civilization

• Buildings cost -10%, except for towers, walls and Wonders
• Towers cost -40%
• Swordsmen attack 50% faster
• Ballista and Helepolis +1 range

Team Bonus:
Priests +50% heal speed
120163:
Elephant, Camel, and Naval civilization

• Start the game with +50 of all resources
• Academy units and elephant units +25% hit points, Camel Riders +15% hit points
• Fire Galley +25% attack
• Transport ships move 25% faster
• Nobility free (requires Government Center)

Team Bonus:
Academies work 20% faster
120164:
Camel and Trading civilization

• Villagers cost 75 Food, but have +1/+1P armor and work 25% faster
• Start the game with +75 Food
• Camel Riders move 25% faster
• Tributes are not taxed
• Trade units return +20% gold

Team Bonus:
Technologies researched 30% faster
120165:
Infantry civilization

• All non-ranged units +2 line of sight
• Academy units +1P armor in Bronze Age, +2 in Iron Age
• Siege Workshop units cost -25%
• All units 4 times more resistant to conversion

Team Bonus:
Houses +50 HP
120166:
Archer civilization

• Foragers work 15% faster
• Military Units created 25% faster

Build Farm (‹cost›)
Renewable food source. Provides a limited amount of food before it goes fallow and must be rebuilt. Only one Villager may work a Farm at a time. You can farm abandoned enemy Farms. Cannot be converted by enemy Priests.

‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor›

Tower with a ranged attack. Weak vs. siege units and Slingers.
Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); hit points, attack, accuracy, construction speed (Government Center); range (Market); to Sentry Tower 120F, 50S (Granary).‹DEFAULT›

326327:
Build Small Gate (‹cost›)
Can be built into existing walls to allow movement of friendly units. Can be locked and unlocked. Cannot be converted by enemy Priests.
Upgrades: hit points, construction speed (Government Center), to Medium Wall 180F, 100S (Granary).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›

Can be built into existing walls to allow movement of friendly units. Can be locked and unlocked. Cannot be converted by enemy Priests.
Upgrades: hit points, construction speed (Government Center), to Fortified Wall 300F, 175S (Granary).‹DEFAULT›

326329:
Build Fortified Gate (‹cost›)
Can be built into existing walls to allow movement of friendly units. Can be locked and unlocked. Cannot be converted by enemy Priests.
Upgrades: hit points, construction speed (Government Center).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
326334:
Build Wonder (‹cost›)
A Wonder of the World that demonstrates the superiority of your civilization. Constructing a Wonder that stands for a certain period of time is one way to win the game. Cannot be converted by enemy Priests.
Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); hit points, construction speed (Government Center).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
326335:
Build Ballista Tower (‹cost›)
Tower with a ranged attack. Weak vs. siege units.
Upgrades: line of sight (Town Center); hit points, attack, accuracy, construction speed (Government Center); range (Market).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
326336:
Build Juggernaut (‹cost›)
Anti-building siege warship with long range. Strong vs. buildings.
Upgrades: attack, accuracy, range (Government Center).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
326337:
Build Helepolis (‹cost›)
Anti-unit siege weapon. Cannot attack enemies at close range. Strong vs. slow units, also good against buildings. Weak vs. cavalry and siege weapons.
Upgrades: attack, range, accuracy (Government Center).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
326338:
Build Heavy Catapult (‹cost›)
Ranged siege weapon with area of effect attack. Cannot attack enemies at close range. Strong vs. buildings and tight groups of units. Weak vs. fast units. Can attack ground and destroy trees.
Upgrades: attack, range, accuracy (Government Center).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
326339:
Train Heavy Horse Archer (‹cost›)
Very fast mounted archer. Strong vs. slow units at long range. Weak vs. units at close range.
Upgrades: range (Market), armor (Storage Pit); attack, hitpoints, accuracy (Government Center).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
326340:
Train Legionary (‹cost›)
All-purpose infantry unit. Weak vs. Cavalry.
Upgrades: attack, armor, pierce armor (Storage Pit); population space (Government Center).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
326341:
Train Cataphract (‹cost›)
Fast and heavily armored mounted unit with bonus damage against infantry. Strong vs. infantry and archers. Weak vs. Camel Riders.
Upgrades: attack, armor (Storage Pit); hitpoints (Government Center); to Heavy Cavalry 350F, 125G (Stable).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
326342:
Train Centurion (‹cost›)
Slow and powerful elite infantry unit. Strong vs. melee units.
Upgrades: attack, armor, pierce armor (Storage Pit); speed (Government Center).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
326350:
Train Slinger (‹cost›)
Ranged anti-archer unit. Strong vs. archers, towers and walls. Weak vs. other units.
Upgrades: attack, range (Market); pierce armor (Storage Pit), attack, accuracy, population space (Government Center).‹DEFAULT›
‹hp› ‹attack› ‹armor› ‹piercearmor› ‹range›
326351:
Train Camel Rider (‹cost›)
Fast anti-cavalry unit. Strong vs. mounted units.
Upgrades: attack, armor (Storage Pit); hitpoints (Government Center).‹DEFAULT›

Upgrades: armor (Storage Pit).‹DEFAULT›

326471:
Build Trade Cart (‹cost›)
Trade unit used for generating gold at another player's Market. To trade, click the Trade Cart then right-click another player's Market. Will return with gold to your Market.
